Detailed Description

Decider for the 802.15.4 Narrow band module.

Author:
Jerome Rousselot, Amre El-Hoiydi, Marc Loebbers, Karl Wessel (port for MiXiM)

Definition at line 21 of file Decider802154Narrow.h.

Member Function Documentation

void Decider802154Narrow::channelChanged ( int   )  [virtual]

Called by phy layer to indicate that the channel this radio currently listens to has changed.

Sub-classing deciders which support multiple channels should override this method to handle the effects of channel changes on ongoing receptions.

Parameters:
newChannel The new channel the radio has changed to.

Reimplemented from Decider.

simtime_t Decider802154Narrow::processSignalEnd ( AirFrame *  frame  )  [protected, virtual]

Process the end of a signal.

Checks if signal was received correct and sends it up to the MAC layer.

Reimplemented from BaseDecider.

00130   // TODO: add error correction code.

00132   simtime_t curTime = iter->getPosition().getTime();
00133   simtime_t snrDuration;
00134   while(curTime < end) {
00135     //get SNR for this interval
00136     double snr = iter->getValue();
00137 
00138     //determine end of this interval
00139     simtime_t nextTime = end; //either the end of the signal...
00140     if(iter->hasNext()) {   //or the position of the next entry
00141       const Argument& argNext = iter->getNextPosition();
00142       nextTime = std::min(argNext.getTime(), nextTime);
00143       iter->next(); //the iterator will already point to the next entry
00144     }
00145 
00146     if (noErrors) {
00147       snrDuration = nextTime - curTime;
00148 
00149       int nbBits = int (SIMTIME_DBL(snrDuration) * bitrate);
00150 
00151       // non-coherent detection of m-ary orthogonal signals in an AWGN
00152       // Channel
00153       // Digital Communications, John G. Proakis, section 4.3.2
00154       // p. 212, (4.3.32)
00155       //  Pm = sum(n=1,n=M-1){(-1)^(n+1)choose(M-1,n) 1/(n+1) exp(-nkgamma/(n+1))}
00156       // Pb = 2^(k-1)/(2^k - 1) Pm
00157 
00158 
00159       ber     = getBERFromSNR(snr);
00160       avgBER  = ber*nbBits;
00161       snirAvg = snirAvg + snr*SIMTIME_DBL(snrDuration);
00162 
00163       if(ber < bestBER) {
00164         bestBER = ber;
00165       }
00166       errorProbability = 1.0 - pow((1.0 - ber), nbBits);
00167       noErrors = errorProbability < uniform(0, 1);
00168     }
00169     if (snr < snirMin)
00170       snirMin = snr;
00171 
00172     curTime = nextTime;
00173   }
00174   delete iter;
00175   delete snrMapping;
00176 
00177   avgBER = avgBER / frame->getBitLength();
00178   snirAvg = snirAvg / (end - start);
00179   //double rssi = 10*log10(snirAvg);
00180   double rssi = calcChannelSenseRSSI(start, end);
00181   if (noErrors)
00182   {
00183     phy->sendUp(frame,
00184           new DeciderResult802154Narrow(true, bitrate, snirMin, avgBER, rssi));
00185     if(recordStats) {
00186       snirReceived.record(10*log10(snirMin));  // in dB
00187     }
00188   } else {
00189     MacPkt* mac = static_cast<MacPkt*> (frame->decapsulate());
00190     mac->setName("BIT_ERRORS");
00191     mac->setKind(PACKET_DROPPED);
00192 
00193     PhyToMacControlInfo::setControlInfo(mac, new DeciderResult802154Narrow(false, bitrate, snirMin, avgBER, rssi));
00194     phy->sendControlMsgToMac(mac);
00195     if(recordStats) {

00197     }
00198     if(hasInterference) {
00199       nbFramesWithInterferenceDropped++;
00200     } else {
00201       nbFramesWithoutInterferenceDropped++;
00202     }
00203   }
00204 
00205   //decoding is done
00206   currentSignal.first = 0;
00207 
00208   //channel is back idle
00209   setChannelIdleStatus(true);
00210

simtime_t Decider802154Narrow::processSignalHeader ( AirFrame *   )  [protected, virtual]

Processes the end of the header of a received Signal.

Returns the time it wants to handle the signal again.

Default implementation does not handle signal headers.

Reimplemented from BaseDecider.
